awd_titl_txt: Symmetries and Asymmetries of Geomagnetic Fluctuations in   High Latitude Conjugate Regions
awd_abstract_narration: This project is the continuation of research involving the                      operation of, and analysis of, data from a magnetometer at                      Frobisher Bay, NWT, Canada.  The magnetometer is almost exactly                 "conjugate" to the South Pole station which supports a                          magnetometer belonging to the Co-Principal Investigator,                        L.J. Lanzerotti of AT&T Bell Laboratories.                                                                                                                      The object of the investigation is to determine the extent to                   which these two very high lattitude stations have similar or                    different magnetic flucuations and how the similarities or                      differences are controlled by the solar wind as measured by                     several space craft.  Of particular interest are the magnetic                   signature of the merging of the sun's interplanetary magnetic                   field with the earth's field; so called flux transfer events.

inst.inst_name: CUNY New York City College of Technology
